alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a triazole ring fused to a pyridine ring. Triazole is a five-membered ring consisting of two carbon atoms and three nitrogen atoms. Pyridine is a 6-membered ring consisting of five carbon atoms and one nitrogen center.
alternative_parents.name: Triazolopyridines

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds contaning a phenoxy group.
alternative_parents.name: Phenoxy compounds

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing an ether group substituted with a benzene ring.
alternative_parents.name: Phenol ethers

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a benzene with exactly two chlorine atoms attached to it.
alternative_parents.name: Dichlorobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl aryl ether functional group with the generic formula R-O-R' , where R is an alkyl group and R' is an aryl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl aryl ethers

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyridine ring, which is a six-member aromatic heterocycle which consists of one nitrogen atom and five carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Pyridines and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acyl chloride functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl chlorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds arising by replacement of one or both hydrogen atoms of acetylene (ethyne) by a metal or other cationic group. E.g. NaC#CH monosodium acetylide. By extension, analogous compounds derived from terminal acetylenes, RC#CH. The class is limited here to derivatives of acetylene where the hydrogen atom is replaced with an element with similar or lower electronegativity that carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Acetylides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds comprising a five-member nitrogen heterocyclic ring containing at least one other non-carbon atom of either nitrogen, sulfur, or oxygen.
class.name: Azoles

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenyl-1,2,4-triazoles. These are organic compounds containing a 1,2,4-triazole substituted by a phenyl group.

direct_parent.description: Organic compounds containing a 1,2,4-triazole substituted by a phenyl group.
direct_parent.name: Phenyl-1,2,4-triazoles

intermediate_nodes.description: Organic aromatic compounds containing a phenyl group substituted with a triazole ring.
intermediate_nodes.name: Phenyltriazoles

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds containing  a five-member aromatic ring of two carbon atoms and three nitrogen atoms.
subclass.name: Triazoles

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
